thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: GE earnings top Wall Street forecasts
thread.title_full: GE earnings top Wall Street forecasts

author: courier-journal.com
title: GE earnings top Wall Street forecasts
text:
General Electric's ( GE ) third-quarter financial results topped Wall Street expectations Friday as the U.S. conglomerate posted improved earnings amid continued moves to refocus on its manufacturing roots.
Shares of Connecticut-based GE closed nearly 3.4% higher at $28.98.
The company reported $2.51 billion in earnings, or 25 cents per share, down from $3.54 billion, or 35 cents per share, for the same three-month period last year. Adjusted earnings, excluding special charges, were 29 cents per share, GE said.
Third-quarter revenue totaled $31.68 billion, down 1% from $32.1 billion last year.
Wall Street analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters had forecast nearly $28.65 billion in revenue and 26 cents in earnings per share.
USA TODAY
GE to sell $30B lending and leasing firms to Wells Fargo
The results came three days after GE sold $30 billion in commercial lending and leasing businesses to Wells Fargo, the latest step in a restructuring plan aimed at selling an estimated $200 billion in assets from the company's GE Capital financing division. The strategy features renewed focus on aviation, energy, transportation and health care, marking a return to GE's manufacturing heritage and a shift away from financing.
The company, viewed as a proxy for the U.S. manufacturing sector, said revenue from its aviation division rose 5% from the year-earlier quarter. GE's power and water division posted an equivalent rise of 1%. However, the company reported oil and gas revenue were down 16% year-over-year, amid a continuing global slump of energy prices.
GE said it plans to launch a share exchange next week for the Synchrony Financial division, GE's consumer finance arm, after winning approval from the Federal Reserve. The exchange is expected to produce a 6% to 7% reduction in the nearly 10.1 billion shares of GE stock outstanding as of June 30.
File photo taken in 2014 shows the General Electric logo at a store in Cranberry Township, Pa. (Photo: Gene J. Puskar, AP)
"Our GE Capital exit plan is ahead of plan and we expect GE Capital dividends to the parent (company) of approximately $3 billion for 2015," GE Chairman and CEO Jeffrey Immelt said in a statement.
Through the expected Synchrony exchange and dividends, "we are on track to return approximately $30 billion to share owners in 2015," added Immelt.
